means: <尤英>（土地、房产）根据地契年期而拥有的

sentence.Network_en: The property register will also say whether the property is freehold or leasehold.
sentence.Network_cn: 房产注册簿上也会说明房产是终身保有的还是租借的。

sentence.Network_en: I went into a leasehold property at four hundred and fifty pounds rent per year.
sentence.Network_cn: 我以每年450英镑的租金租了一所房子。

sentence.Network_en: People owning leasehold homes will be given a new right to buy the freehold of their property.
sentence.Network_cn: 房屋租赁者将获得购买所住房产终身保有权的新权利。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent.: from lease, on the pattern of freehold

entry.def: If a building or land is described as leasehold, it is allowed to be used in return for payment according to the terms of a lease.

example.ex: I went into a leasehold property at four hundred and fifty pounds rent per year.
example.tran: 我以每年450英镑的租金租了一所房子。

entry.tran: （按租约使用房屋或土地的）租赁权
entry.def: If you have the leasehold of a building or piece of land, you have the legal right to use it for a period of time as arranged according to a lease.

means.word_mean: 1. land or property held under a lease
